quest_title: p-nitrophenol and o-nitrophenol are separated by
explanation_txt: o-nitro phenol has intra molecular hydrogen bonding, while p-nitrophenol has intermolecular hydrogen bonding (comparitively stronger). Due to this reason, the boiling point of o-nitrophenol is found quite less than that of p-nitrophenol. Hence, o-nitrophenol is steam volatile and can be separated from p-nitrophenol by steam distillation.
question_plain_title: p-nitrophenol and o-nitrophenol are separated by
explanation_plain_text: o-nitro phenol has intra molecular hydrogen bonding, while p-nitrophenol has intermolecular hydrogen bonding (comparitively stronger). Due to this reason, the boiling point of o-nitrophenol is found quite less than that of p-nitrophenol. Hence, o-nitrophenol is steam volatile and can be separated from p-nitrophenol by steam distillation.

quest_title: Ethyl iodide when boiled with the alcoholic KOH, the product formed is
explanation_txt:
Ethyl iodide when boiled with the alcoholic KOH, the product formed is ethene.

\(CH_3CH_3I+\underset{alc}{KOH}\to \underset{Ethene}{CH_2=CH_2}+KOH+H_2O\)

This reaction is dehydrohalogenation reaction.

quest_title: If \(|a|\, =3,\, \, |b|\, =4\) then a value of \(\lambda\) for which \(a+\lambda b\) is perpendicular to \(a-\lambda b\) is
explanation_txt:
Since \(a+\lambda b\)is perpendicular to \(a-\lambda b\), then their dot product will be zero.

So, \((a+\lambda b).(a-\lambda b)=0\) \(\Rightarrow\) \(|a|^{2} -\lambda ^{2} |b|^{2} =0\)

or \(\lambda ^{2} =\cfrac{|a|^{2} }{|b|^{2} } \Rightarrow \lambda ^{2} =\cfrac{9}{16} \) or \(\lambda =\pm \cfrac{3}{4} \),

\([{\mkern1mu\raise4pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu\raise1pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu\raise4pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu} \, |a|=3,|b|=4]\).

quest_title: \[\lim _ { x \rightarrow \pi / 6 } \cfrac { \cot ^ { 2 } \theta - 3 } { \text{cosec } \theta - 2 } =\]
explanation_txt: \[\lim _ { x \rightarrow \pi / 6 } \cfrac { \text{cosec } ^ { 2 } \theta - 4 } { \text{cosec } \theta - 2 } = \lim _ { x \rightarrow \pi / 6 } \text{cosec } \theta + 2 = 4\]

quest_title: The area of a rectangle will be maximum for the given perimeter, when rectangle is a :
explanation_txt:
We know that perimeter of a rectangle \(S=2(x+y)\), where \(\textit{x}\) and \(\textit{y}\) are adjacent sides

\( \Rightarrow \) \(y=\cfrac{S-2x}{2} \).

Now area of rectangle, \[A=xy=\cfrac{x}{2} (S-2x)=\cfrac{1}{2} (Sx-2x^{2} )\]

Differentiating \(\textit{w}\). \(\textit{r}\). \(\textit{t}\). \(\textit{x}\) of \(\textit{A}\), we get \(\cfrac{dA}{dx} =\cfrac{1}{2} (S-4x)=0\, \, \, {\mkern1mu\raise1pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu\raise4pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu\raise1pt\hbox{.}\mkern1mu} x=\cfrac{S}{4} \)and \(y=\cfrac{S}{4} \)

Again \(\cfrac{d^{2} A}{dx^{2} } =-ve\)

Hence the area of rectangle will be maximum when rectangle is a square.
question_plain_title: The area of a rectangle will be maximum for the given perimeter, when rectangle is a :
explanation_plain_text:
We know that perimeter of a rectangle , where and are adjacent sides

.

Now area of rectangle,

quest_title: A bomb of mass 9kg explodes into 2 pieces of mass 3kg and 6kg. The velocity of mass 3kg is 1.6 m/s, the K.E. of mass 6kg is
explanation_txt:
As the bomb initially was at rest therefore

Initial momentum of bomb = 0

Final momentum of system = \(m _ { 1 } v _ { 1 } + m _ { 2 } v _ { 2 }\)

As there is no external force

\(\therefore m _ { 1 } v _ { 1 } + m _ { 2 } v _ { 2 } = 0 \Rightarrow 3 \times 1.6 + 6 \times v _ { 2 } = 0\)

Its kinetic energy \(= \cfrac { 1 } { 2 } m _ { 2 } v _ { 2 } ^ { 2 } = \cfrac { 1 } { 2 } \times 6 \times ( 0.8 ) ^ { 2 } = 1.92 J\)

quest_title: First law of thermodynamics is given by
ans1_txt: \(d Q = d U + P d V\)
ans2_txt: \(d Q = d U \times P d V\)
ans3_txt: \(d Q = ( d U + d V ) P\)
ans4_txt: \(d Q = P d U + d V\)
explanation_txt:
First law of thermodynamics is the consequence of conservation of energy. It states that heat given to a system \(d Q\) is equal to the sum of increase in its internal energy \(d U\) and the work done \(d W\) by the system against the surroundings.

\(d Q = d U + d W\)

And work done by a gas can be expressed as

\(d W=F \cdot d x=(PA) d x=P d V\)

Therefore, \(dQ=dU+PdV\)

quest_title: The Young's experiment is performed with the lights of blue (\(\lambda\) = 4360 Å) and green colour (\(\lambda\) = 5460 Å), If the distance of the 4th fringe from the centre is x, then
explanation_txt:
Distance of nth bright fringe \(y _ { n } = \cfrac { n \lambda D } { d } \text { ie. } y _ { n } \propto \lambda \)

\(\therefore \cfrac { x _ { n _ { 1 } } } { x _ { n _ { 2 } } } = \cfrac { \lambda _ { 1 } } { \lambda _ { 2 } } \Rightarrow \cfrac { x ( \text { Blue } ) } { x ( \text { Green } ) } = \cfrac { 4360 } { 5460 }\)

\(x (Blue) < x (Green)\)

quest_title: The distance between a point source of light and a screen which is 60 \(\textit{cm}\) is increased to 180 \(\textit{cm}\). The intensity on the screen as compared with the original intensity will be
explanation_txt:
Intensity is inversely proportional to the square of distance from the source.

\(I\propto \cfrac{1}{r^{2} } \)

\(\Rightarrow \cfrac{I_{2} }{I_{1} } =\cfrac{r_{1}^{2} }{r_{2}^{2} } \)\(=\cfrac{60^{2} }{180^{2} } =\cfrac{1}{9} \)
question_plain_title: The distance between a point source of light and a screen which is 60 is increased to 180 . The intensity on the screen as compared with the original intensity will be
explanation_plain_text: Intensity is inversely proportional to the square of distance from the source.

quest_title: In total internal reflection when the angle of incidence is equal to the critical angle for the pair of media in contact, what will be angle of refraction?
explanation_txt:
At \(i=i_{c}\), refracted ray grazes with the surface.

So, angle of refraction is 90°.

quest_title: A smaller loop of area of cross-section 10\({}^{-4}\) m\({}^{2}\) is lying concentrically and coplanar inside a bigger loop of radius 0.628 m. A current of 10 A is passed in the bigger loop. The smaller loop is rotated about its diameter with angular velocity `\(\text{\(\omega\)}\)'. The magnetic flux linked with small loop will be
explanation_txt:
\(\text { We know that, } \phi=B A \cos \omega t \)
\(\text { Here, } B=\cfrac{\mu_{0} i}{2 r} \)
\(\therefore \phi=\cfrac{\mu_{0} i}{2 r} A \cos \omega t \)
\(=\cfrac{\left(4 \times 3.14 \times 10^{-7}\right) \times 10 \times 10^{-4} \times \cos \omega t}{2 \times 0.628} \)
\(=10^{-9} \cos \omega t \)
question_plain_title: A smaller loop of area of cross-section 10 m is lying concentrically and coplanar inside a bigger loop of radius 0.628 m. A current of 10 A is passed in the bigger loop. The smaller loop is rotated about its diameter with angular velocity `'. The magnetic flux linked with small loop will be
ans1_plain_text: 10 sin
ans2_plain_text: 10 cos
ans3_plain_text: 10 sin
ans4_plain_text: 10 cos

quest_title: The locus of the point of intersection of the perpendicular tangents to the parabola \(x ^ { 2 } = 4 a y\) is
explanation_txt:
Consider a parabola \( y^2 = 4ax \)

Tangent is: \( y = mx + a/m \)

The perpendicular tangent is \( y = -x/m - am \)

Their intersection is obtained by:

\( mx + a/m = -am - x/m \\ (m+1/m)x = -(m+1/m)a \\ x = -a \)

which is equation of directiex.

quest_title: The function \(f : R \rightarrow R\) defined by \(f ( x ) = ( x - 1 ) ( x - 2 ) ( x - 3 ) \) is
explanation_txt:
We have \( f ( x ) = ( x - 1 ) ( x - 2 ) ( x - 3 ) \)

and \(f ( 1 ) = f ( 2 ) = f ( 3 ) = 0 \Rightarrow f ( x )\) is not one-one.

For each \(y \in \mathbb{R} \), there exists \(x \in \mathbb{R} \) such that \(f ( x ) = y\). Therefore f is onto. Hence is onto but not one-one.

quest_title: Which of the following is Loschmidt number
explanation_txt:
The no. of molecules present in 1 \(\textit{ml}\) of gas at STP is known as Laschmidt number.

22400 \(\textit{ml}\) of gas has total no. of molecules \[=6.023\times 10^{23} \]

1 \(\textit{ml}\) of gas has total no. of molecules \(=\cfrac{6.023\times 10^{23} }{22400} \) \[=2.69\times 10^{19} .\]
question_plain_title: Which of the following is Loschmidt number
explanation_plain_text:
The no. of molecules present in 1 of gas at STP is known as Laschmidt number.

22400 of gas has total no. of molecules

1 of gas has total no. of molecules

quest_title: The period of \( \cosh ({\theta \over 4}) \) is:
explanation_txt:
Note this:

  • \(\cosh x = \cos (ix) \)
  • \(\sinh x = \cfrac {\sin (ix)} { i} \)

Now, the period of \(\cos (ax) \) is \(\cfrac {2 \pi} {a}\)

Hence, the answer is (a).

NOTE that, the period is always positive!

quest_title: Equal volumes of 0.8M-HCl. 0.50M KOH and 0.5M KCl are mixed. The molarity of resulting \(\text{sol\({}^{n}\)}\) with regard to KCl is
explanation_txt:
0.5 M KOH reacts with 0.5M HCl to give 0.5M KCl

Total KCl = 0.5M +0.5M = 1M

Total Volume = 1+1+1 = 3

\(\therefore\) Molarity of resulting solution = \(\cfrac{1}{3}M\)
